revised_title: Note on Rev. Robert Harley's Paper: Professor Malet's Classes of Invariants and Sir James Cockle's Criticoids
tldr: In this article, the author clarifies a misunderstanding regarding the originality of his work on classes of invariants and their relation to Sir James Cockle's research. He also briefly discusses Claude Bernard and Heidenhain's observations on nerve and gland physiology, specifically the effects of sectioning the chorda tympani nerve on saliva secretion in the submaxillary glands.
